questions.question_text:
During the execution of a hybrid project, one developer had to be replaced. The new resource is extremely competent in quality assurance tasks, but does not have much experience in development.

What should the project manager do?

choices.C: Move the developer to another team and look for a replacement developer.
choices.D: Maintain the same task allocation structure to avoid any disruption in the project team.
choices.A: Allow the team to reevaluate the tasks and determine how they should be allocated.
choices.B: Request that all quality assurance tasks be allocated to the new resource.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Allow the team to reevaluate the tasks and determine how they should be allocated

questions.question_text:
A project team is globally distributed with team members living and working in different time zones. The project manager is trying to get the team to collaborate effectively.

Which three actions should the project manager take to accomplish this goal? (Choose three.)

choices.C: Compile a communications management plan with input from all stakeholders and distribute for review and approval.
choices.D: Require the team to have daily mandatory meetings with the project management office (PMO).
choices.E: Recommend the use of formal written documentation in all project communications.
choices.A: Send out a survey to review the preferred method, timing, and frequency for communications.
choices.B: Review the communications strategy with the team regularly with a view for continuous improvement.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABC
A. Send out a survey to review the preferred method, timing, and frequency for communications.
B. Review the communications strategy with the team regularly with a view for continuous improvement.
C. Compile a communications management plan with input from all stakeholders and distribute for review and approval.

choices.B: Ensure that all product features are completed as per the communicated specifications before releasing to market.
choices.C: Send a detailed report to each steering committee member ahead of the meeting.
choices.A: Ensure the content of the project report is clearly understood and request any necessary feedback.
choices.D: Invite critical stakeholders to the daily project review meetings to ensure their full engagement and involvement.

questions.question_text:
In a project steering committee meeting, a few stakeholders raise concerns that the project manager's report shows that the outcome of the project is already in the market while the project is still in development. The project manager explains that the project is being delivered in sprints and involves different releases.

What should the project manager do to avoid a reoccurrence of this scenario?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Answer A just repeats the question in answer format. It assumes that the stakeholders didn't clearly understand not provide feedback: the feedback was that they were concerned that the report shows the product in the market, which they clearly understand to be the case. Answer A avoids the notion that the manager's report is inferior or doesn't align with the communications plan requirements. 
Answer B allows for the notion that the manager's report itself is inferior (or that the communications plan is inferior).

Selected Answer: A
A. Ensure the content of the project report is clearly understood and request any necessary feedback

questions.question_text:
A company has an existing contract to maintain and enhance a client's customer database. The company's legal department informs the project manager that a new piece of legislature requiring stricter protection of customer information might soon be signed into law. The law will require additional security features to be implemented into the database the project manager is maintaining. These features are not included in the scope of the current contract.

What should the project manager do?

choices.B: Ask the legal department to raise the issue in the next contract negotiation with the customer.
choices.A: Update the risk register to include this issue and discuss the appropriate risk response plans with the project sponsor and client.
choices.D: Wait until the legal requirements are finalized so the change in scope can be concretely defined.
choices.C: Seek the project sponsor's support to influence the client to amend the contract immediately.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Communicate the project's impact and plans to engage the project team throughout the project

questions.question_text:
A company has decided to initiate a project to eliminate a sales channel that has been unprofitable for the past 3 years. Some members of the project team are pessimistic about the project.

What should the project manager do in this situation?

choices.D: Provide team members with specific and clear instructions on the project objectives and tasks.
choices.A: Communicate the project's impact and plans to engage the project team throughout the project.
choices.C: Escalate the team's concerns and ask the project sponsor to change the team's composition.
choices.B: Engage the functional managers to describe the project's impact to the team members directly.
